page.title: 01Shalford
page.content: This is an area of mainly arable farming. There is one dairy herd and some pigs and sheep. The river{Pant}flows through {Shalford,}passing{Wethersfield}and {Codham Water Mills.}The{Pant}forms the boundary between the parishes of {Shalford}and{Wethersfield.}The{Chapel {of Ease}at{Blackmore End}belongs to {Wethersfield,}but they share the same vicar,{Rev Alex Irwin.}On the{Pant, near{Codham Mill}there is a fish farm. There are two sand pits, one at { {Shalford}and the other at{Beazley End. Both are now closed. There is ancient woodland which is part of the{Bovingdon Hall Estate. { }The{B1053 Road}runs through {Shalford,}SE towards{Braintree}and NE linking{Wethersfield}and{Finchingfield An infrequent bus service on this road also serves{Panfield. }
